Articles.Content:
Any advice for Eve Ascent Vehicles?

Edited July 11, 2016 by max_creative
Page 5!

35 minutes ago, max_creative said:

Any advice for Eve Ascent Vehicles?

Moar boosters??? 

Edited July 11, 2016 by Just Jim

16 hours ago, max_creative said:

Any advice for Eve Ascent Vehicles?

Go minimalist. Orbital payload should be Kerbals in seats, a probe core, a reaction wheel, and minimal batteries. As well as maybe a solar panel and the last stage. The last stage should be something like a flt-200 with a 0.625m engine (depending on your payload).

Then, if you have a 1.25m rocket, add asparagused aerospikes or asparagused vectors underneath. If it is a 0.625 meter rocket, you won't need as many asparagus stacks. If it is a 2.5m final stage, uh, asparagused orange tank vectors?!?!?!? I don't have much experience in that field, so...

A few points for Eve ascent:

--Mammoths are great first stage engines. High thrust and acceptable Isp
--Use aircraft landing wheels, they're much more robust than legs
--Aerospikes are ideal upper stages
--be able to discard entry/landing parts such as parachutes to save liftoff mass
--surface refueling can help a LOT!

You don't need to put kerbs in seats if you make a big enough ship and design it right. I got 5 crew to orbit in nice comfy cabins, with plenty of dV to spare

If you ISRU it's actually not too tough - just haul an empty lander out to Eve.

(Real kerbs do it the old-fashioned way, though.)

9 hours ago, Kuzzter said:

A few points for Eve ascent:

--Mammoths are great first stage engines. High thrust and acceptable Isp
--Use aircraft landing wheels, they're much more robust than legs
--Aerospikes are ideal upper stages
--be able to discard entry/landing parts such as parachutes to save liftoff mass
--surface refueling can help a LOT!

I just strapped a LOT of Vectors on a bunch of fuel tanks. All your tips I completely agree with. I spent a few hours looking at Eve Ascent vehicles. I actually also took so ideas from the MAV in the Martian. 

Eve acsent vehicle abort went well... 

 

Landing test didn't...
The M49 is so big that even Jeb agrees it has too many boosters. Yes, the name is a reference to @Kuzzter's M7...

6 hours ago, max_creative said:

M49

49 MAMMOTHS?!?!?!?!?!?

Wow...

Somewhat relevant is that @Kuzzter's original Tylo lander was called Tylo X6... and I actually brought 6 Tylo landers to Tylo...

On July 14, 2016 at 9:13 PM, Ultimate Steve said:

49 MAMMOTHS?!?!?!?!?!?

Wow...

Erm... The current count is 75... It got halfway to Dres just by burning prograde and pressing Z. I think it might even be slightly over engineered for Eve Ascent... 

I'm working on a space colony to orbit Laythe. That's why I haven't made a chapter recently. That and swim team championships... I also plan on putting a dome on Laythe soon.
Yay! Can't wait to read the next chapter! Also I think Gerty should remain Gerty. I don't exactly know if the contest is still up, but that's my opinion.

On August 23, 2016 at 0:45 AM, Mycroft said:

Yay! Can't wait to read the next chapter! Also I think Gerty should remain Gerty. I don't exactly know if the contest is still up, but that's my opinion.

Gerty will stay Gerty. And I annilated all the mun irsu bases, just in case. Next chapter might be awhile though. Imgur is killing my story. Soonest I can get a chapter is Wendsday. That's when school starts, and I might have a friend over to help. Might. Until then, I probably will just finish the redstone missile base for him...

1.2 is coming soon, and so is a lot MOAR chapters... 

Interlude 11 1/2: preparing for 1.2! (Ish)

Another bored meeting at the KSC... 

Gene: 1.2 is coming soon. Today we have a meeting because we can and stuff.

Gerty: yeah. 

Jeb: what? Chapter 1002 is coming soon? 

Gene: no, update 1- 

Jeb: Cool! That software update that Linus was making for Gerty, right? 

Gene: no, that's v1.14592, and- 

Jeb: -it's done! 

Gene: ... 

Gerty, no, it's not comp- 

*Jeb presses button* 

Gerty: 

Spoiler

Question: how do you take a save and put it in a different version? Being more specific: how do you take my main save from 1.1 and put it in 1.2? Between today and Friday next week I want to make at least 1 new chapter using 1.2!

Ok, here's how I do it:

1) Download the new version (obviously) and unzip it.

2) Open both the file that has the old version install and the file that has the new version install in two separate windows. 

3) Open the "saves" file in both windows. 

4) Move all files in the "saves" file EXCEPT for scenarios and training from the old install to the new install. 

5) Close the files and launch KSP from the new install.
